alert.note: Alert for Chesterfield; Fairfield; Kershaw; Richland; Southern Lancaster (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 7:46PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Fairfield, Lancaster, Chesterfield, north central Richland and Kershaw Counties through 845 PM EDT... At 746 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles west of Sturdivants to near Heath Springs to near Winnsboro. Movement was southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lancaster, Camden, Cheraw, Winnsboro, Lake Wateree Dam, Pageland, Kershaw, Chesterfield, Elgin, Heath Springs, Liberty Hill, Lake Wateree State Park, Westville, Cheraw State Park, Irwin, Northeastern Technical College, Cassatt, Cheraw Municipal Airport, Carolina Sandhills Wildlife Refuge and Mt Pisgah. This includes Interstate 77 between mile markers 30 and 50. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for central South Carolina.
